intro: Descurainia pinnata var. paradisa, commonly known as the paradise tansy, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It has alternate, pinnately compound leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The seeds are small and release a strong, unpleasant odor when crushed, which helps deter herbivores.
